tutorial.speak:
To establish roles for members of your staff and volunteers, navigate to the Chums Dashboard, then to Settings.
In Settings, choose Roles.
The screen will show all the roles you have set up. The Domain Admin role is reserved for those who have complete control and permissions of all ChurchApps programs.
The person who set up the account is the first Domain Admin. Caution: Do not delete the last Domain Admin. There must be at least one Domain Admin for the programs to function.
You can easily add other Domain Admins.
Search for the person you want to add. If the person does not have an account, you can create a new user.
You can also assign limited permissions using a custom role or a default role.
Add a custom role.
In this example, it is called “Check-in.”
After you have created the custom role, click on it and add members.
Edit the permissions for this role.
Add people to this role just like before.
These people will only have permission for check-in.
